meanings.definition: To cause to go or be taken to a destination.
meanings.sent1: I will send the letter to my friend.
meanings.sent2: Please send the package to the correct address.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally sent my cat to the wrong room.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to send a wave of happiness through the room.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind can send leaves flying in all directions.

meanings.definition: To dispatch by a means of communication.
meanings.sent1: I will send you a text message later.
meanings.sent2: He sent an email to his boss about the project.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to send messages using sign language.
meanings.sent4: His eyes seemed to send a silent plea for help.
meanings.sent5: The radio tower can send signals across long distances.

meanings.definition: To cause to be in a particular state or condition.
meanings.sent1: The news of the accident sent her into a panic.
meanings.sent2: The spicy food sent my taste buds into overdrive.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected compliment sent him blushing.
meanings.sent4: The music seemed to send her into a trance-like state.
meanings.sent5: The storm can send the whole town into chaos.
